The image humorously contrasts two interpretations of adding dressing to a salad. 

On the left, there is a simple illustration of a salad—a typical expectation of what a salad should look like. On the right, a stick figure is pouring an exaggerated amount of dressing onto a salad in a cartoonish, minimalist style.

The humor arises from the juxtaposition of the phrase "YES, BUT" with the visual. It suggests that while salad is usually seen as a healthy option ("YES"), the tendency to overuse dressing can undermine its benefits ("BUT"). The exaggerated amount of dressing humorously highlights this common pitfall in a visually striking and satirical way. Additionally, the hand drawing the scene emphasizes the deliberate and comical exaggeration.
